myExercises.title: My Exercises
myExercises.activeProgramsDescription: Your current exercise programs based on pain assessments
myExercises.noEndedPrograms: You don't have any ended programs yet.

exercisePlanPage.generalDescription: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.
exercisePlanPage.title: Exercise Plan

exercisePlan.suitableQuestion: Is this exercise suitable for you?
exercisePlan.painQuestion: 1. Does the exercise cause you pain?
exercisePlan.changeQuestion: 2. Do you want to change this exercise?
exercisePlan.changeRequestInfo: After submitting this request, we will contact you regarding a suitable exercise replacement.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.text: These exercises are recommended based on your assessment. If you experience severe pain or discomfort, consult a healthcare professional.

generalProgram.title: General Program
generalProgram.description: Don't have time for individual programs? Here you'll find a personalized program with the most important exercises from your programs. Follow the instructions and stop exercising if you feel pain.

centralSensitisationNeck.title: General exercises for cervical spine pain reduction

wallBallMassage.title: Wall ball massage
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball for this exercise. Place the ball on your trapezius, lean against the wall and massage the neck muscles as shown in the video. If you find painful spots, you can apply static pressure for 20-30 seconds. Massage the entire trapezius and interscapular area.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

wallPushUps.title: Wall push-ups
wallPushUps.description:
Place your hands against the wall wider than your shoulders. Step 1 step away from the wall (the further you are from the wall, the harder the push-ups will be). Make sure your hands are positioned lower than your shoulders.
➜ WARNING: Do not arch your lower back during the exercise, but maintain a firm core. Do not lift your shoulders during the exercise to prevent trapezius tightness, but try to push the shoulder blades down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-15 push-ups / 3 series.

centralSensitisationMiddleBack.title: General exercises for thoracic spine pain reduction

prayer.title: Prayer - neck and shoulder blade release
prayer.description: Join your palms and elbows at 90-degree angles in the elbows and shoulders. With continuous connection, slowly raise your elbows higher, but still KEEP JOINED elbows and palms. WARNING: try to keep your fingers pointing toward the ceiling. REPETITIONS: 20 seconds / 2x in a row / 2x daily.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic spine massage with ball
thoracicSpineMassage.description:
Place the ball in the interscapular space and release painful and stiff muscles with vertical movement.
➜ REPETITIONS: anytime during the day.

bookOpening.title: Book opening
bookOpening.description:
This exercise will increase chest mobility.
➜ Lie on your side, bend your legs and join your palms in front of you. Together with the upper limb, rotate to the opposite side while exhaling. The head should follow the hand throughout. Stay in this position for 3 seconds.
➜ REPETITIONS: 5x to each side, anytime during the day.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

centralSensitisationLowerBack.title: General exercises for lumbar spine pain reduction

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

defaultNeck.title: General exercises for cervical spine pain reduction

wallBallMassage.title: Wall ball massage
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball for this exercise. Place the ball on your trapezius, lean against the wall and massage the neck muscles as shown in the video. If you find painful spots, you can apply static pressure for 20-30 seconds. Massage the entire trapezius and interscapular area.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

wallPushUps.title: Wall push-ups
wallPushUps.description:
Place your hands against the wall wider than your shoulders. Step 1 step away from the wall (the further you are from the wall, the harder the push-ups will be). Make sure your hands are positioned lower than your shoulders.
➜ WARNING: Do not arch your lower back during the exercise, but maintain a firm core. Do not lift your shoulders during the exercise to prevent trapezius tightness, but try to push the shoulder blades down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-15 push-ups / 3 series.

defaultMiddleBackWeek02.title: Week 0-2
defaultMiddleBackWeek02.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve thoracic mobility and reduce pain.

thoracicRotationWithExtension.title: Thoracic rotation with extension
thoracicRotationWithExtension.description:
Sit and place your hands behind your head.
➜ Slowly rotate in the thoracic spine to the side to a range that is comfortable for you. Stop in this position and slightly extend. Then return and repeat the exercise to the opposite side.
➜ REPETITIONS: repeat 5-8x to each side, anytime during the day.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic spine massage with ball
thoracicSpineMassage.description:
Place the ball in the interscapular space and release painful and stiff muscles with vertical movement.
➜ REPETITIONS: anytime during the day.

defaultMiddleBackWeek35.title: Week 3-5
defaultMiddleBackWeek35.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve thoracic mobility and reduce pain.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

thoracicExtension.title: Thoracic spine extension
thoracicExtension.description:
Press your palms against the wall, step away from it so you are in a slight forward lean and exhale to release the trunk into extension. Try to keep your shoulders relaxed throughout, head in extension of the spine and breathe 1-2 times in the extension position.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat extension 3-4x, anytime during the day.

bookOpening.title: Book opening
bookOpening.description:
This exercise will increase chest mobility.
➜ Lie on your side, bend your legs and join your palms in front of you. Together with the upper limb, rotate to the opposite side while exhaling. The head should follow the hand throughout. Stay in this position for 3 seconds.
➜ REPETITIONS: 5x to each side, anytime during the day.

defaultLowerBack.title: General exercises for lumbar spine pain reduction

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

radicularPainNeckWeek03.title: Week 0-3
radicularPainNeckWeek03.description: Gentle exercises for nerve root release in the cervical area and reduction of neurological symptoms.

neckRetraction.title: Neck retraction
neckRetraction.description:
Sit and relax your shoulders. Place the index finger of one hand on your chin and slowly retract your chin inward (as shown in the video). Perform the retraction range only as far as comfortable, this exercise should not produce any pain! Then extend your chin slightly forward again. Throughout, try to keep your shoulders relaxed, not tense them and keep your head level without forward or backward movements.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / anytime during the day.

upperLimbNeurodynamics.title: Upper limb neurodynamics
upperLimbNeurodynamics.description:
Procedure: Sit and relax trapezius
➜ raise arm with palm facing up
➜ bend palm away from you, along with extended fingers
Return palm back and bend elbow to 90 degrees
➜ repeat movement
REPETITIONS: repeat 10-15 x / 5x daily

neckSideBending.title: Neck side bending
neckSideBending.description:
Sit and start performing side bends. Perform the bending range maximum to pain and do not stay in this position - immediately return to neutral position.
➜ REPETITIONS: 6-8x to each side.
➜ WARNING: if one side is more painful, limit the range and repetitions to this position.

radicularPainNeckWeek46.title: Week 4-6
radicularPainNeckWeek46.description: Increased mobility in the cervical spine and pain reduction.

prayer.title: Prayer - neck and shoulder blade release
prayer.description: Join your palms and elbows at 90-degree angles in the elbows and shoulders. With continuous connection, slowly raise your elbows higher, but still KEEP JOINED elbows and palms. WARNING: try to keep your fingers still pointing toward the ceiling. REPETITIONS: 20 seconds / 2x in a row / 2x daily.

wallBallMassage.title: Wall ball massage
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball for this exercise. Place the ball on your trapezius, lean against the wall and massage the neck muscles as shown in the video. If you find painful spots, you can apply static pressure for 20-30 seconds. Massage the entire trapezius and interscapular area.

radicularPainLowerBackWeek03.title: Week 0-3
radicularPainLowerBackWeek03.description: Exercises focused on gentle mobilization of nerve structures in the lumbar area.

sciaticNeurodynamics.title: Sciatic nerve neurodynamics
sciaticNeurodynamics.description:
Description in video.
➜ REPETITIONS: 15x / 3-5x daily
➜ WARNING: immediately after exercise you may feel slight leg numbness. It should pass within half a minute, otherwise reduce the number of repetitions or skip the exercise.

pelvicTilting.title: Pelvic tilting
pelvicTilting.description:
Anytime during the day, relieve stiff lumbar muscles by tilting the pelvis. Perform the range of motion only as far as comfortable and does not cause more pain.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat 15x anytime during the day.

radicularPainLowerBackWeek46.title: Week 4-6
radicularPainLowerBackWeek46.description: Exercises focused on strengthening gluteal muscles and adaptation to load.

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

radiculopathyNeckWeek02.title: Week 0-2
radiculopathyNeckWeek02.description: Exercises to reduce neurological symptoms and reduce pressure on nerve root.

tensionNeurodynamics.title: Tension neurodynamics
tensionNeurodynamics.description:
Procedure:
Sit and relax trapezius
➜ raise arm with palm facing up
➜ bend palm away from you, along with extended fingers and head pull away from arm.
Return palm back and bend elbow to 90 degrees repeat movement
REPETITIONS: repeat 10-15 x / 5x daily.
➜ WARNING: Pull head away only to pain. When you feel strong pull in arm or pain, immediately return head and arm to neutral position!

mckenzieExtensions.title: McKenzie cervical spine extensions
mckenzieExtensions.description:
Procedure:
➜ sit and relax trapezius
➜ retract chin (retraction), but do not lift shoulders or flex head forward
➜ extend head to a range that is comfortable and does not cause much pain
➜ in extension make short head rotations to both sides
➜ REPETITIONS: repeat extension 5-10x in a row with 3-5 rotations to each side ➜ 5x daily.

radiculopathyNeckWeek35.title: Week 3-5
radiculopathyNeckWeek35.description: Strengthening muscles in the neck and interscapular area.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

neckStrengthening.title: Neck muscle strengthening
neckStrengthening.description:
Sit and place both hands behind your head. Try to keep your shoulders relaxed.
➜ Press your head into your palms and palms into your head, so that the neck muscles on the back of the cervical spine are tensed. Throughout, try to keep your head upright.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10sec. pressure / 10sec. pause / 5x in a row. You can repeat the exercise 2-3x daily.

radiculopathyLowerBackWeek02.title: Week 0-2
radiculopathyLowerBackWeek02.description: Exercises focused on reducing neurological symptoms of the lower limb.

proximalSciaticNeurodynamics.title: Proximal sciatic nerve neurodynamics
proximalSciaticNeurodynamics.description:
Lie on your back and bend your legs. Lift the lower limb with symptoms and hold behind the knee. Carefully pull your toe toward you and slowly straighten your knee until you feel a pull in your leg, then immediately return to the original position.
➜ WARNING: this exercise may cause slight limb numbness after completion, which should go away within a minute - this is normal. If you feel symptoms persist longer, stop this exercise.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-12 repetitions / 4-5x daily.

mckenzieExtensions.title: McKenzie extensions
mckenzieExtensions.description:
Procedure:
➜ lie on your stomach with hands as shown in video
➜ push trunk away from surface into extension with palms
➜ warning: keep buttocks relaxed, do not clench gluteal muscles!
➜ extend only to the point where movement is comfortable and does not cause you more pain
REPETITIONS: 10x / 4-5x daily

radiculopathyLowerBackWeek35.title: Week 3-5
radiculopathyLowerBackWeek35.description: Exercises focused on increasing load on lumbar spine and gluteal muscles.

glutealMassage.title: Gluteal muscle massage
glutealMassage.description:
Take a tennis ball, place it on your gluteal muscles and lean against the wall with it (as shown in video).
➜ Carefully press into the ball and massage the gluteal muscle area just below the pelvic rim with horizontal movements.
➜ REPETITIONS: a few minutes daily.

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

defaultLowerBack.title: Basic lumbar spine exercises
defaultLowerBack.description: Basic exercises for strengthening and mobilization of lumbar spine

pelvicTilting.title: Pelvic tilting
pelvicTilting.description:
Anytime during the day, relieve stiff lumbar muscles by tilting the pelvis. Perform the range of motion only as far as comfortable and does not cause more pain.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat 15x anytime during the day.

upperLimbNeurodynamics.description:

➜ raise arm with palm facing up
➜ bend palm away from you, along with extended fingers
Return palm back and bend elbow to 90 degrees
➜ repeat movement
REPETITIONS: repeat 10-15 x / 5x daily

discHerniationNeckWeek03.description: Pain reduction exercises that help stabilize the cervical spine and reduce pressure on intervertebral discs.

➜ REPETITIONS: repeat extension 5-10x in a row with 3-5 rotations to each side ➜ 5x daily.

discHerniationNeckWeek46.description: Move to a more advanced program to release the cervical spine and reduce pressure on your discs

discHerniationLowerBackWeek03.title: Exercise program 0-3 weeks
discHerniationLowerBackWeek03.description: Basic exercises for probable disc damage with the aim of reducing pain and preventing further damage.

mckenzieExtensions.title: McKenzie extensions
mckenzieExtensions.description:
Procedure:
➜ lie on your stomach with hands as shown in video
➜ push trunk away from surface into extension with palms
➜ warning: keep buttocks relaxed, do not clench gluteal muscles!
➜ extend only to the point where movement is comfortable and does not cause you more pain
REPETITIONS: 10x / 4-5x daily

sciaticNeurodynamics.title: Sciatic nerve neurodynamics
sciaticNeurodynamics.description:
Description in video.
➜ REPETITIONS: 15x / 3-5x daily
➜ WARNING: immediately after exercise you may feel slight leg numbness. It should pass within half a minute, otherwise reduce the number of repetitions or skip the exercise.

discHerniationLowerBackWeek46.title: Exercise program 4-6 weeks
discHerniationLowerBackWeek46.description: Advanced exercises for strengthening the lumbar spine and preventing further damage to your discs.

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

facetJointSyndromeNeckWeek02.title: Week 0-2
facetJointSyndromeNeckWeek02.description: Exercises to increase range of motion in the neck and reduce pain.

cervicalRotationWithTowel.title: Cervical spine rotation with towel
cervicalRotationWithTowel.description:
This exercise will help you increase your range of motion into rotation.
➜ Hold the towel as shown in the video - the upper hand determines the direction you will turn your head, the lower hand fixes. Pull down with the lower hand and maintain tension while simultaneously pulling forward and up with the upper hand while maintaining tension. Then perform rotation toward the upper limb side with continuous tension of both hands.
➜ During this exercise you should feel increased range of motion and less pain when rotating your head.
➜ REPETITIONS: 6x rotation to one side / anytime during the day.

trapezoidMassage.title: Trapezius massage against wall
trapezoidMassage.description: Use a tennis ball for this exercise. Place the ball on your trapezius, lean against the wall and massage the neck muscles as shown in the video. If you find painful spots, you can apply static pressure for 20-30 seconds. Massage the entire trapezius and interscapular area.

upperCervicalMassage.title: Upper cervical spine massage
upperCervicalMassage.description:
Sit and palpate the skull edge behind and slightly below your ear.
➜ Press with thumbs under the skull and massage the occiput with circular movements. Always when you return to the skull edge after circling, press into the bone and proceed to the center of the spine.
➜ WARNING: This exercise may be slightly painful, so sitting is appropriate! Pain may radiate to the head or behind the eye when pressed.
➜ Repeat as needed anytime during the day, especially if you feel stiffness and head and neck pain.

facetJointSyndromeNeckWeek35.title: Week 3-5
facetJointSyndromeNeckWeek35.description: Exercises for strengthening the interscapular area and neck + emphasis on prevention.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

neckStrengthening.title: Neck muscle strengthening
neckStrengthening.description:
Sit and place both hands behind your head. Try to keep your shoulders relaxed.
➜ Press your head into your palms and palms into your head, so that the neck muscles on the back of the cervical spine are tensed. Throughout, try to keep your head upright.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10sec. pressure / 10sec. pause / 5x in a row. You can repeat the exercise 2-3x daily.

facetJointSyndromeMiddleBackWeek02.title: Week 0-2
facetJointSyndromeMiddleBackWeek02.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve thoracic mobility and reduce pain.

thoracicRotationWithExtension.title: Thoracic rotation with extension
thoracicRotationWithExtension.description:
Sit and place your hands behind your head.
➜ Slowly rotate in the thoracic spine to the side to a range that is comfortable for you. Stop in this position and slightly extend. Then return and repeat the exercise to the opposite side.
➜ REPETITIONS: repeat 5-8x to each side, anytime during the day.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic spine massage with ball
thoracicSpineMassage.description:
Place the ball in the interscapular space and release painful and stiff muscles with vertical movement.
➜ REPETITIONS: anytime during the day.

facetJointSyndromeMiddleBackWeek35.title: Week 3-5
facetJointSyndromeMiddleBackWeek35.description: Gentle rotational movements to improve thoracic mobility and reduce pain.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Interscapular muscle strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description:
Hold the resistance band as shown in the video. You can alternate between these 3 exercises or choose any one of them.
➜ WARNING: You must not feel strain in the trapezius during these exercises! Always try to push the shoulder blades and shoulders down away from the ears so the interscapular muscles work. Make sure you feel the muscles between the shoulder blades more during the exercises, not the shoulders and trapezius - achieve this by pressing the shoulders down.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10-15x / 3 series / 1x daily.

thoracicExtension.title: Thoracic spine extension
thoracicExtension.description:
Press your palms against the wall, step away from it so you are in a slight forward lean and exhale to release the trunk into extension. Try to keep your shoulders relaxed throughout, head in extension of the spine and breathe 1-2 times in the extension position.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat extension 3-4x, anytime during the day.

bookOpening.title: Book opening
bookOpening.description:
This exercise will increase chest mobility.
➜ Lie on your side, bend your legs and join your palms in front of you. Together with the upper limb, rotate to the opposite side while exhaling. The head should follow the hand throughout. Stay in this position for 3 seconds.
➜ REPETITIONS: 5x to each side, anytime during the day.

facetJointSyndromeLowerBackWeek03.title: Week 0-3
facetJointSyndromeLowerBackWeek03.description: Releasing lumbar muscles and increasing mobility

pelvicTilting.title: Pelvic tilting
pelvicTilting.description:
Anytime during the day, relieve stiff lumbar muscles by tilting the pelvis. Perform the range of motion only as far as comfortable and does not cause more pain.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat 15x anytime during the day.

spinalStretching.title: Spinal muscle stretching
spinalStretching.description:
Sit and place your chin on your chest. Slowly flex forward by rounding your back and still keep your chin on your chest. In full flexion, breathe 2-3 times into your abdomen and then slowly straighten. The last movement will be straightening your head to neutral position.
➜ WARNING: After straightening from flexion, you may feel dizzy. Always keep your eyes open and do not stand up immediately from sitting.
➜ REPETITIONS: 2x in a row, anytime during the day.

facetJointSyndromeLowerBackWeek46.title: Week 4-6
facetJointSyndromeLowerBackWeek46.description: Strengthen the gluteal area and prevent lumbar overload.

bridge.title: Bridge
bridge.description:
Lie on your back and place bent legs shoulder-width apart.
➜ Place your hands along your body.
➜ Press your feet into the surface and lift your buttocks above the surface, to the height where you straighten your back
➜ Then slowly lower your buttocks just above the surface and repeat
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-12x / 4 series / 1x daily

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

sijMobilization.title: SI joint mobilization
sijMobilization.description:
Get on all fours with knees shoulder-width apart and feet pointing toward each other.
➜ Slowly sit on your heels and during the movement round your back with your head down. Perform the movement with exhalation and relax for a few seconds in the sitting position on your heels.
➜ REPETITIONS: 5x in a row, anytime during the day.

squats90.title: 90-degree squats
squats90.description:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
➜ Perform squats max. to 90 degrees of knee flexion and without bending in the back.
➜ REPETITIONS: 10x / 3 series / 1x daily

glutealStrengthening.title: Gluteal muscle strengthening
glutealStrengthening.description:
Choose one or more exercises from the video to strengthen gluteal muscles. Be careful not to arch your lower back and to feel the work of gluteal muscles and hamstrings during exercise.
➜ REPETITIONS: 8-10x / 2-3 series / 1x daily

defaultNeck.title: Basic cervical spine exercises
defaultNeck.description: General exercises for strengthening and mobilization of cervical spine.

wallBallMassage.title: Wall ball massage
wallBallMassage.description: Use a tennis ball for this exercise. Place the ball on your trapezius, lean against the wall and massage the neck muscles as shown in the video. If you find painful spots, you can apply static pressure for 20-30 seconds. Massage the entire trapezius and interscapular area.

prayer.title: Prayer - neck and shoulder blade release
prayer.description: Join your palms and elbows at 90-degree angles in the elbows and shoulders. With continuous connection, slowly raise your elbows higher, but still KEEP JOINED elbows and palms. WARNING: try to keep your fingers still pointing toward the ceiling. REPETITIONS: 20 seconds / 2x in a row / 2x daily.

upperCervicalMassage.title: Upper cervical spine massage
upperCervicalMassage.description:
Sit and palpate the skull edge behind and slightly below your ear.
➜ Press with thumbs under the skull and massage the occiput with circular movements. Always when you return to the skull edge after circling, press into the bone and proceed to the center of the spine.
➜ WARNING: This exercise may be slightly painful, so sitting is appropriate! Pain may radiate to the head or behind the eye when pressed.
➜ Repeat as needed anytime during the day, especially if you feel stiffness and head and neck pain.

defaultMiddleBack.title: Basic thoracic spine exercises
defaultMiddleBack.description: General exercises for strengthening and mobilization of thoracic spine.

prayer.title: Prayer - neck and shoulder blade release
prayer.description: Join your palms and elbows at 90-degree angles in the elbows and shoulders. With continuous connection, slowly raise your elbows higher, but still KEEP JOINED elbows and palms. WARNING: try to keep your fingers still pointing toward the ceiling. REPETITIONS: 20 seconds / 2x in a row / 2x daily.

thoracicSpineMassage.title: Thoracic spine massage with ball
thoracicSpineMassage.description:
Place the ball in the interscapular space and release painful and stiff muscles with vertical movement.
➜ REPETITIONS: anytime during the day.

bookOpening.title: Book opening
bookOpening.description:
This exercise will increase chest mobility.
➜ Lie on your side, bend your legs and join your palms in front of you. Together with the upper limb, rotate to the opposite side while exhaling. The head should follow the hand throughout. Stay in this position for 3 seconds.
➜ REPETITIONS: 5x to each side, anytime during the day.

defaultLowerBack.title: Basic lumbar spine exercises
defaultLowerBack.description: Basic exercises for strengthening and mobilization of lumbar spine

pelvicTilting.title: Pelvic tilting
pelvicTilting.description:
Anytime during the day, relieve stiff lumbar muscles by tilting the pelvis. Perform the range of motion only as far as comfortable and does not cause more pain.
➜ REPETITIONS: Repeat 15x anytime during the day.

frozenShoulderPhase1.title: Frozen Shoulder - Phase 1: Pain Relief and Gentle Mobility
frozenShoulderPhase1.description: Initial phase focused on pain management and gentle mobility exercises. Perform these exercises 2-3 times daily during the acute phase.

pendulumExercises.title: Pendulum Exercises
pendulumExercises.description: Lean forward and perform rocking movements to maintain shoulder mobility without active movement. Perform 10-15 swings in each direction, 2-3 times daily.

isometricExternalRotation.title: Isometric External Rotation
isometricExternalRotation.description: Lend your hand against the wall as shown in the video. Keep your elbow close to your body and press the wall with moderate force by rotating your arm. Be careful not to lift your shoulders towards your ears during the exercise. Hold for 8-10 seconds, repeat 5 times, 1-2 times a day.

rotatorCuffRelease.title: Rotator cuff and trapezius massage with a ball
rotatorCuffRelease.description: Take a tennis ball, place it on your trapezius and lean against the wall. Press lightly with your body weight and massage the trapezius and shoulder blade area. You may feel pain during the exercise, as long as it is tolerable. When you find a painful point, statically press for about 20-30 seconds and then move lower. Perform the exercise at least 1 time a day.

shoulderHeating.title: Shoulder Heating
shoulderHeating.description: Use a heating pad/pad and heat the entire shoulder and shoulder blade area. Alternatively, you can use the shoulder blow-drying technique, but ALWAYS WITH A TOWEL PLACED ON THE HEATED BODY PART to protect against burns. Heat for at least 15-20 minutes.

frozenShoulderPhase2.title: Frozen Shoulder - Phase 2: Progressive Strengthening
frozenShoulderPhase2.description: Progressive strengthening phase when pain begins to subside. Focus on rebuilding shoulder strength and stability.

isometricShoulderPresses.title: Isometric Shoulder Presses
isometricShoulderPresses.description: Progressive strengthening exercises to rebuild shoulder muscle strength. Hold for 10-15 seconds, repeat 10-15 times.

wallPushUps.title: Wall Push-Ups
wallPushUps.description: Modified push-ups against the wall to strengthen shoulder and chest muscles safely. Start with 10 repetitions, progress gradually.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Upper Back and Shoulder Blade Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthening exercises for the muscles between shoulder blades to improve posture and shoulder stability. Perform 10-15 repetitions.

subacromialImpingement.title: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome - Pain Relief and Mobility
subacromialImpingement.description: Exercises designed to reduce impingement and improve shoulder mechanics. Focus on creating space in the shoulder joint.

interscapularStrengthening.title: Shoulder Blade Strengthening
interscapularStrengthening.description: Strengthening the muscles that pull shoulder blades together to improve shoulder alignment and reduce impingement.

gentlePendulum.title: Gentle Pendulum Swings
gentlePendulum.description: Light pendulum movements to maintain mobility without aggravating impingement. Keep movements small and pain-free.

preExerciseHeating.title: Pre-Exercise Warming
preExerciseHeating.description: Warming exercises to prepare the shoulder joint before performing other therapeutic exercises.

rotatorCuffTear.title: Rotator Cuff Tear - Conservative Management
rotatorCuffTear.description: Conservative treatment focusing on pain management and maintaining available range of motion.

isometricStrengthening.title: Isometric Strengthening
isometricStrengthening.description: Gentle strengthening without movement to avoid further damage while maintaining muscle tone.

rotatorCuffMassage.title: Rotator Cuff Massage
rotatorCuffMassage.description: Self-massage techniques to improve circulation and reduce muscle tension around the rotator cuff.

defaultNociceptive.title: General Shoulder Pain Management
defaultNociceptive.description: General exercises for shoulder pain when specific diagnosis is unclear. Focus on basic mobility and gentle strengthening.

basicMobility.title: Basic Shoulder Mobility
basicMobility.description: Fundamental exercises to maintain or restore basic shoulder range of motion.

basicStrengthening.title: Basic Shoulder Strengthening
basicStrengthening.description: Simple strengthening exercises suitable for most shoulder conditions.
